intro: Bupleurum aureum subsp. porfirii, commonly known as golden bupleurum, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its botanical characteristics include a fibrous root system and a branching stem that can reach up to 30 cm in height. It is often found in alpine meadows and is valued for its ornamental appeal and traditional medicinal uses.
